title: Add contact details, chatbot lead capture, and stronger marketing copy + images

requirements.text: Update all displayed and linked contact details across the site to use email swiftsports1512@gmail.com and phone number 8431680623 (including mailto: and tel: links, copy-to-clipboard values, and any prefilled email actions).

quotes: Please add email - swiftsports1512@gmail.com and contact number - 8431680623.

acceptanceCriteria: The Contact section email card shows swiftsports1512@gmail.com and its copy button copies swiftsports1512@gmail.com.
The Contact section phone card shows 8431680623 (in a readable formatted display is OK) and its copy button copies 8431680623.
Any tel: link uses the correct number (e.g., tel:8431680623 or tel:+918431680623), and any mailto: link uses swiftsports1512@gmail.com.
The footer contact email/phone display and links are updated to the same values.
The “Send via Email” action in the contact section sends to swiftsports1512@gmail.com.

requirements.text: Add an on-site chatbot-style lead-capture UI that collects sports referee requirements (e.g., sport, number of referees/officials needed, date/time, location, competition level, and requester contact details) and allows the user to submit the request.

quotes: also add a chat bot to capture the required sports referees

acceptanceCriteria: A chat widget is available on the landing page (e.g., floating button) and can be opened/closed without navigating away.
The chatbot flow collects at minimum: sport, number of officials required, date (or date/time), location, competition level, and the requester’s name + phone or email.
The user can review and submit the captured information at the end of the chat flow.
After submission, the UI shows a clear success confirmation and a reference identifier (or timestamp) for the request.
User-facing text in the chatbot is in English.

requirements.text: Persist submitted chatbot lead-capture requests in the Motoko backend so they are not lost on refresh, and expose backend methods to create and list submitted requests for internal verification/testing.

quotes: add a chat bot to capture the required sports referees

acceptanceCriteria: Backend defines a stable data structure to store submitted referee requests (including all fields collected by the chatbot plus createdAt).
Frontend submission calls the backend to store the request and handles errors gracefully (shows an error state if submission fails).
Backend exposes at least one query method that returns the list of stored requests (for developer/internal verification).
No additional backend canisters/services are introduced; all logic remains in backend/main.mo (single-actor architecture).

requirements.text: Strengthen site marketing copy (headlines, subheadlines, service descriptions, and CTAs) to be more conversion-focused and attention-grabbing while staying accurate for a sports officials provider.

quotes: also add best marketing lines ... to grab atentation

acceptanceCriteria: Hero section headline/subheadline and CTA labels are updated with stronger marketing language (English).
Services and/or process section copy is refreshed with clearer benefits and outcomes (e.g., reliability, certified officials, fast replacements).
Contact section copy encourages action and aligns with the updated contact details.
All updated copy remains consistent in tone and does not introduce new product offerings not present on the site.

requirements.text: Add attention-grabbing marketing images to the landing page and integrate them as static assets (not served from the backend), ensuring they match the existing SwiftSport branding and overall theme.
acceptanceCriteria: New images are added under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced directly by the frontend.
At least one prominent image is displayed in/near the hero section, and at least one supporting image is displayed in another section (e.g., services/process/contact).
Images are responsive (look good on mobile and desktop) and do not cause layout shift issues.
All images have appropriate alt text in English.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Do not introduce third-party chatbot services or external databases; store lead-capture submissions using the existing single Motoko actor backend.
Keep all user-facing text in English.
nonGoals: Integrating external live chat providers (Intercom, Drift, WhatsApp, etc.).
Sending emails/SMS automatically from the backend.
Adding multi-page admin dashboards for managing leads (beyond basic list/query for verification).

required: Hero marketing image: dynamic sports officiating scene illustration/photo-style with modern sporty lighting (swiftsport-hero.dim_1600x900.png)
Supporting section image: referee whistle + clipboard / match readiness visual, clean modern style (swiftsport-support-1.dim_1200x800.png)
Chatbot avatar/mascot icon: friendly sports-official themed assistant, flat vector style, transparent background (swiftsport-chatbot-avatar.dim_256x256.png)
